We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary

Responsibilities

title: Receptionist Job at Management FIRST
content:
Management FIRST - Our client, a top beauty clinic and spa in Abuja, is seeking to hire a well experienced and detailed individual for immediate employment to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Receptionist undertakes all receptionist and clerical duties at the desk of the main entrance. You will be the “face” of the company for all visitors and will be responsible for the first impression that will be made.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Keep front desk tidy and presentable with all necessary material (pens, forms, paper etc.)
	Greet and welcome guests
	Answer questions and address complaints
	Answer all incoming calls and redirect them or keep messages
	Receive letters, packages etc. and distribute them
	Prepare outgoing mail by drafting correspondence, securing parcels etc.
	Check, sort and forward emails
	Monitor office supplies and place orders when necessary
	Keep updated records and files
	Monitor office expenses and costs
	Take up other duties as assigned (travel arrangements, schedules etc.)


Requirements


	Proven experience as front desk representative, agent or relevant position
	Familiarity with office machines (e.g. fax, printer etc.)
	Knowledge of office management and basic bookkeeping
	Proficient in English (oral and written)
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office (especially Excel and Word)
	Strong communication and people skills
	Good organizational and multi-tasking abilities
	Problem-solving skills
	Customer service orientation.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: recruitmentwithmanagementfirst@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Customer Service Coordinator Job at FoliXx Hospitality
content:
FoliXx Hospitality, established in 2018, provides a sophisticated and contemporary entertainment experience. From renowned themed nightlife events and live performances to exceptional restaurants and special occasions. We are a fast-growing and dynamic hospitality group with business units that include a Quick Service Restaurant (QSR), a Fine Dining Lounge, and a vibrant Nightclub.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Coordinator

Job Location: Ikate, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Customer Care Supervisor is responsible for leading a team of front-line customer care agents/maids/hostesses to ensure that every customer interaction is handled with care, speed, empathy, and professionalism.
	You’ll serve as the first escalation point for customer concerns, and work closely with management to track feedback trends, suggest improvements, and enforce a high standard of customer satisfaction across all units.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise day-to-day activities of the customer care/frontline team.
	Ensure timely and professional resolution of all customer complaints, inquiries, and requests (in-person, via phone, or online).
	Track, log, and escalate recurring issues to management and operations for review.
	Monitor staff-customer interactions to ensure warmth, courtesy, product knowledge, and engagement.
	Mentor and coach junior customer service staff to ensure consistency in brand voice, etiquette, grooming, and tone.
	Perform regular checks on service delivery flow across customer touchpoints (entrance, seating, service, payment, etc.).
	Oversee and enforce company dress code, grooming, and hospitality culture among hostesses, maidens, and other customer-facing roles.
	Conduct briefings before shifts and debrief after shifts to share feedback and align expectations.
	Coordinate with Floor Supervisors, Kitchen, Bar, and Security teams to ensure smooth guest experience.
	Handle customer escalations and VIP/client concerns directly, ensuring swift and satisfactory resolution.
	Ensure effective management of reservation systems, appointment bookings, and guest list.
	Generate and submit customer feedback reports, reviews summaries, and incident logs weekly.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND / Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality, Business Administration, or related fields
	2–4 years of proven experience in customer service, preferably within the hospitality, food service, or retail sector
	Minimum of 1 year in a supervisory or team lead role
	Flexible availability including nights, weekends, and public holidays
	Knowledge of customer service metrics and reporting is a plus
	Ability to speak confidently in English (additional local languages are a plus).


Required Skills & Competencies:


	Strong leadership and supervisory skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
	Problem-solving mindset with emotional intelligence
	High attention to detail and strong follow-through
	Ability to multitask in high-pressure environments
	Tech-savvy with experience in POS systems, reservation tools, or CRM platforms
	Professional appearance and demeanor.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short cover letter to: hr@folixxhospitality.com using "Customer Care Supervisor" as the subject of the email.

title: Human Resources Information System (HRIS) Officer Job at Dangote Group
content:
Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Information System (HRIS) Officer

Job Location: Apapa, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Human Resources Information System (HRIS) Officer will be responsible for managing and optimizing the HRIS database to ensure the accurate collection, management, and reporting of employee data.
	This role will involve working closely with HR teams to automate processes and enhance data accessibility, thus supporting strategic HR decision-making.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the HRIS to ensure system integrity and accuracy of data.
	Support HR initiatives by maintaining employee data and ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations.
	Develop and generate reports and analytics to inform HR strategies and improve operational efficiencies.
	Assist in the design and implementation of new HRIS modules and features.
	Provide training and support to HR personnel and end-users on HRIS functionalities.
	Collaborate with IT for system upgrades, troubleshooting issues, and maintaining system security.
	Conduct regular audits of employee data to ensure accuracy and compliance.
	Stay updated on HRIS best practices and emerging technologies. 
	Participate in change management initiatives relating to HRIS updates.


Requirement & Competencies


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Information Technology, Business Administration or a related field.
	Proven experience working as an HRIS Officer or similar role.
	Strong understanding of HR processes and data management.
	Proficiency in HRIS software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Workday) and advanced Excel skills.
	Knowledge of database management and data security standards.
	Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data.
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Opportunities for Professional Growth and Career Advancement
	Paid Time Off
	Training & Development
	Competitive salary
	Collaborative and supportive work environment.

title: Executive Assistant to the Managing Director Job at Bluradish
content:
Bluradish is a modern, customer-centric luxury pawnshop brand committed to providing fast, reliable, and discreet financial solutions. We specialize in short-term loans secured against high-value luxury items such as watches, designer fashion, jewelry, and electronics. Our approach blends professionalism, confidentiality, and a high-end retail experience that sets us apart in the industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the Managing Director

Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a highly organized, polished, and proactive Executive Assistant to support the Managing Director in driving the strategic and operational goals of the business.
	The ideal candidate will have 3–5 years of experience supporting C-level executives, preferably within a luxury business environment (e.g., fashion, retail, hospitality, or lifestyle brands).
	The Executive Assistant will serve as a trusted gatekeeper and project coordinator, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations and helping the MD stay focused on leadership and business development.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide high-level administrative support to the Managing Director, including calendar management, travel arrangements, meeting scheduling, and email correspondence.
	Serve as the first point of contact and liaison between the MD and internal/external stakeholders, clients, and partners.
	Prepare, review, and organize documents, reports, presentations, and meeting agendas.
	Coordinate business meetings, events, and confidential matters with discretion and professionalism.
	Track and follow up on action items, deadlines, and project milestones on behalf of the MD.
	Handle confidential information with integrity and professionalism.
	Assist with personal executive tasks as needed to support the overall performance of the MD.
	Stay attuned to the luxury brand voice and assist in communications, brand-related tasks, and special projects when required.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Communications, or related field
	3 - 5 years of proven experience as an Executive Assistant supporting senior executives, ideally in a luxury-focused business or corporate environment
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills with a proactive, detail-oriented approach
	Impeccable verbal and written communication skills
	High emotional intelligence, discretion, and professionalism
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, and virtual communication tools (e.g., Zoom, Teams)
	A strong appreciation and understanding of luxury aesthetics, customer service, and brand tone
	Must be based in Lagos


Preferred Qualities:


	Experience in luxury retail, hospitality, or fashion industries
	Familiarity with executive calendar tools, project management platforms (e.g., Asana, Trello), and CRM systems
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment


Why Join Bluradish?


	Opportunity to work closely with a visionary founder in a dynamic, upscale business
	Exposure to the luxury retail and financial services industries
	High-impact role with opportunities for professional growth
	Elegant and collaborative workplace culture


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: career@pawnshopbyblu.com using “Application – Executive Assistant” as the subject of the email.
